creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: irregularly shaped tan jar with bulbous, wasp-nest shaped base, long neck, wide mouth; flecked, dripping brown overglaze, mostly on one side; comes with rattan ring
medium: Sue ware; stoneware with natural ash glaze
text:
須恵器 Sueki stoneware

This type of vessel is known as a “recumbent vessel,” or <I>yokobe<I>. Its asymmetrical body indicates it was meant to be placed on its side—it was probably intended for storing sake (rice wine). Natural ash glaze, pooled on its surface, creates a pleasing mottled effect on its shoulders and a pattern of drips along a portion of the jar’s irregular, bulging body.
title: Recumbent vessel with long neck
